page.title: 10Religion:C of E:Methodism:
page.content: {The Church of England.} The Parish of Langwathby and Edenhall has been joined for hundreds of years. The River Eden is the parish boundary. The vicar is The Reverend Richard Moatt who came to Langwathby in 1985. He looks after many village churches in the area .Until 1974 the vicarage was at Edenhall,from 1974- 1982 it was at Little Salkeld. Since then it has been at Langwathby.There is a choir at Langwathby Church. {The Methodist Church. The Chapel was built in Langwathby 125 years ago.There is a Sunday School for any children in the area. The Minister is The Reverend Harold Hammond. He lives in the manse at Langwathby which was built about 25 years ago.He looks after several chapels in the area.The church and chapel unite for some services during the year.
